article.headline: Hofstra 78, James Madison 75
article.story: HARRISONBURG, Va. (AP) -- Loren Stokes scored seven of his 21 points in a late 18-9 run as Hofstra defeated James Madison 78-75 Saturday night. Mike Radziejewski started the run with two free throws to put Hofstra (4-0, 1-0 Colonial Athletic Association) ahead for good, 58-57, with 5:44 left. Radziejewski also hit a 3-pointer, and Stokes had a three-point play and two layups in the spurt. A free throw by Aurimas Kieza made it 74-66 with 30 seconds left. The Dukes (2-2, 0-1 CAA) closed to within three on Daniel Freeman's jumper with nine seconds left. Hofstra went 3-for-4 from the free-throw line before John Naparlo hit a 3-pointer at the buzzer for the final margin. Kieza and Antoine Agudio scored 14 points apiece, and Carlos Rivera added 11 for Hofstra. James Madison's Daniel Freeman led all scorers with 27 points on 10-of-16 shooting. Ray Barbosa added 16 points, Garbriel Chami 11 and Cavell Johnson 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
